name: InstallWindowsService
description: Install a Windows Service that is running on the same machine as the agent.
author: Stone Co.
helpMarkDown: Install a Windows Service that is running on the same machine as the agent.

inputs.name: ServiceName
inputs.label: Service Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the service that will be installed.

inputs.name: ServiceBinaryPath
inputs.label: Service Binary Path
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The FULL path to the binary that will be installed, usually a .dll ou .exe.
Example: C:\app\MyService.exe

inputs.name: InstallationMode
inputs.label: Installation Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown:
This setting is to select the way the service will be installed, using the InstallUtils or using a custom command for libraries like TopShelf.
With InstallUtils, the installation will be calling like this: InstallUtils.exe $(ServiceBinary).
With custom command, the service binary will be called with custom arguments: $(ServiceBinaryPath) $(InstallArguments)

inputs.name: ServiceUser
inputs.label: Service User
inputs.helpMarkDown: The user that will run the installed service. The default user is the O.S. user.

inputs.name: ServiceAccount
inputs.label: Service Account Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this field to specify which user should run the service.

inputs.name: ServicePassword
inputs.label: Service Account Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Use this field to specify the passoword of the user should run the service.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(serviceAccountPassword)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.
